Detailed Description

Class descripbing the UDP's sent from the MapModule containing the answer to the CoordinatRequestPacket.

After the general ReplyPacket-header the format is (X = REPLY_HEADER_SIZE):
PosSizeComment X 4 bytes The ID of the map where item closest to the coordinate in the RequestPacket is located. X+4 4 bytes The ID of the closest item. X+8 4 bytes The distance from the coordinate in the RequestPacket to the item in this packet. X+12 2 bytes The offset from node 0 that is closest to the coordinate in the RequestPacket. X+14 2 bytes sep The angle, if heading towards node 1 (positive direction). X+16 2 bytes The angle, if heading towards node 0 (negative direction). X+18 2 bytes Padding (to be compatible with the old one). X+20 4 bytes The municipal ID where the item is. X+24 4 bytes The citypart ID where the item is. X+28 4 bytes The built up area where the item is located. X+32 4 bytes The country where the item is located. X+36 4 bytes The latitude part of the coordinate in the RequestPacket. X+40 4 bytes The longitude part of the coordinate in the RequestPacket. X+44--X+104 4 bytes each ID of the maps where the coordinate is located (if coordinate in more than one map). X+108 strings The municipal, city, district and name as strings.

uint32  builtUpAreaID = MAX_UINT32,
uint32  cityPartID = MAX_UINT32
)  [inline]
 

Create a new CoordinateReplyPacket as a reply to a CoordinateRequestPacket.

Parameters:
p The CoordinateRequestPacket that this is a reply to.
status The status of this reply.
mapID The ID of the map where the closest item is located.
itemID The ID of the item that is closest to the given coordinates (in the request packet).
offset The offset at item that is closest to the given coordinates
dist The distance from the coordinates to the clostest point on the item (from (lat,lon) to mapID.itemID.offset).

uint16 CoordinateReplyPacket::getNegativeAngle (   )  const [inline]
 

Get the angle at offset at the item with ID = itemID if traveling in negative direction (towards node 0, that is the same as traversing the item, not following the order of the coordinates).

The angle is calculated clockwise from the north direction in degrees.

Returns:
The angle from north at given offset an heading in positive direction. A value greater than 360 indicate an error!

Definition at line 496 of file CoordinatePacket.h.

bool CoordinateReplyPacket::getStrings (  char *  country,
char *  municipal,
char *  city,
char *  district,
char *  name,
int  maxSize
)  const [inline]
 

Get a copy of the strings in this packet.

The outparameters will never be set to NULL, if no string is available the empty string ("\0") will be returned. The strings that are uses as outparameters must be allocated by the caller!

Parameters:
country Outparameter that is set to the name of the country where the item is located.
municipal Outparameter that is set to the name of the municipal where the item is located.
city Outparameter that is set to the name of the city where the item is located.
district Outparameter that is set to the name of the district (called "city part" in some places in the MC2-system )where the item is located.
name Outparameter that is set to the name of the item.
maxSize The maximum number of characters that are copied into each outparameter.

Definition at line 629 of file CoordinatePacket.h.

bool CoordinateReplyPacket::writeStrings (  const char *  country,
const char *  municipal,
const char *  city,
const char *  district,
const char *  name
)  [inline]
 

Get the names of the item and the location of that item.

The strings might be NULL if the information not is available or not applyable. The names are written in the language that is set in the request packet.

Parameters:
country The name of the country where the item is located.
municipal The name of the municipal where the item is located.
city The name of the city where the item is located.
district The name of the district (called "city part" in some places in the MC2-system )where the item is located.
name The name of the item.
